settings.discript: ROCTANE Electrolyte Capsules help replace what you lose when you sweat to keep you feeling strong and feeling good. Take 1-2 capsules per hour during high-intensity activity and consume with at least 3-4 oz of water as part of your hydration plan. (We recommend drinking at least 16 oz of fluids per hour during exercise.)

- Electrolytes (sodium, magnesium, chloride) to aid in hydration by maintaining fluid balance and plasma volume.†
- Vitamin D, which is important for calcium absorption and bone health.†
- Vitamin B6 to help improve your energy metabolism.
† These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration.  This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.

settings.question: WHAT WOULD WARRANT THE NEED FOR THIS PRODUCT? WHY WAS IT CREATED?
settings.answer:
Created to supplement additional electrolyte replacement needs, GU ROCTANE Electrolyte Capsules provide added electrolyte support on top of our hydration-drink products.

Each bottle includes 50 capsules that are packed with electrolytes (sodium, magnesium, chloride) to aid in hydration by maintaining water balance and plasma volume.

Vitamin D is important for calcium absorption and bone health. Take GU ROCTANE Electrolyte Capsules before, during, or after exercise to replenish electrolyte levels from any energy-demanding activity resulting in sweat loss.

If you’re pushing yourself in hot or humid conditions, it’s easy to become dehydrated. When you’re dehydrated, your performance suffers, you become fatigued faster, and you can get cramps or headaches.

settings.question: DOES VITAMIN D SUPPLEMENTATION HELP EXERCISE PERFORMANCE?
settings.answer: Vitamin D deficiency is common among athletes. In individuals that are vitamin D deficient, supplementation can improve exercise performance.

settings.question: WHY IS VITAMIN B6 IN THE CAPSULE?
settings.answer: Vitamin B6 can help combat that unwanted nausea when athletes push their limits to the max.

settings.question: SHOULD I TAKE THE CAPSULE ONLY DURING EXERCISE?
settings.answer: No! Roctane Electrolyte Capsule can be taken anytime you feel the need to replenish or prevent electrolyte losses due to exercise. It can be taken before, during, or after high intensity efforts.

settings.question: WHY IS THE ELECTROLYTE POTASSIUM NOT IN THE CAPSULE?
settings.answer: There is no data to support potassium supplementation during exercise. Blood potassium concentration does not change or increase during exercise, as potassium is released from muscle contraction. The increase in potassium during exercise is less dramatic as an athlete becomes more trained, which may help prevent fatigue and has been associated with elevated potassium concentration (potentially due to alterations in membrane depolarization). Several studies have even shown that potassium ingestion during exercise doesn’t change blood potassium concentration. For these reasons, potassium is not included in the ROCTANE Electrolyte Capsule.

settings.question: HOW DO I INCORPORATE THIS ROCTANE ELECTROLYTE CAPSULE WITH OTHER GU PRODUCTS?
settings.answer:
Some individuals need more electrolytes than others. The athletes that end each workout looking like a salt stick tend to need more electrolytes than others. These athletes can supplement the electrolytes that are already in gels with 1-2 capsules/hour as needed to help replace electrolytes lost in sweat.

ROCTANE Electrolyte Capsules help replace what you lose when you sweat to keep you feeling strong and feeling good. Take 1-2 capsules per hour during high-intensity activity and consume with at least 3-4 oz of water.

settings.question: ARE ROCTANE ELECTROLYTE CAPSULES SAFE FOR CHILDREN?

settings.title: FAQ
settings.richtext: Find the most frequently asked questions below.

settings.heading: 0 - 1 Hour of effort
settings.text1: For efforts under an hour, it's important to focus on hydration with electrolytes to ensure you feel good both during and after your workout. Water alone can flush through your system without getting to where it needs to go. Replacing sodium helps your system hold your hydration to keep your power output high.

settings.heading: 1 - 2 Hours of effort
settings.text1: When exercising for more than an hour, it's important to replenish fluids and electrolytes along the way to avoid dehydration. Dehydration makes it hard for your heart to circulate blood, which lowers your power output and increases your perceived effort. Along with fluids, add Energy Gels to your plan to replenish the carbs you burn.

settings.heading: 2-3 Hours of effort
settings.text1: For long efforts, particularly in hot, dry, or humid conditions, you sweat more. Replenishing the sodium you lose along with ample fluids is essential feeling good and keeping your power output high. It's also important to refuel with easily digestible carbohydrates along the way by eating one Energy Gel every 45 minutes.

settings.heading: 3-4 Hours of effort
settings.text1: For long efforts, particularly in hot, dry, or humid conditions, you sweat more. Replenishing the sodium you lose along with ample fluids is essential feeling good and keeping your power output high. It's also important to refuel with easily digestible carbohydrates along the way by eating one Energy Gel every 45 minutes.

settings.heading: 4-5 Hours of effort
settings.text1: For long efforts, particularly in hot, dry, or humid conditions, you sweat more. Replenishing the sodium you lose along with ample fluids is essential feeling good and keeping your power output high. It's also important to refuel with easily digestible carbohydrates along the way by eating one Energy Gel every 45 minutes.
